title: Google\Cloud\MediaTranslation\V1beta1\StreamingTranslateSpeechConfig
name: StreamingTranslateSpeechConfig
description:
Config used for streaming translation.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.mediatranslation.v1beta1.StreamingTranslateSpeechConfig

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.audio_config
params.description: Required. The common config for all the following audio contents.

params.name: data.single_utterance
params.description: Optional. If false or omitted, the system performs continuous translation (continuing to wait for and process audio even if the user pauses speaking) until the client closes the input stream (gRPC API) or until the maximum time limit has been reached. May return multiple StreamingTranslateSpeechResults with the is_final flag set to true. If true, the speech translator will detect a single spoken utterance. When it detects that the user has paused or stopped speaking, it will return an END_OF_SINGLE_UTTERANCE event and cease translation. When the client receives 'END_OF_SINGLE_UTTERANCE' event, the client should stop sending the requests. However, clients should keep receiving remaining responses until the stream is terminated. To construct the complete sentence in a streaming way, one should override (if 'is_final' of previous response is false), or append (if 'is_final' of previous response is true).

methods.description:
